intro: Berteroa gintlii, commonly known as the African burr bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by spiny, woody fruits that contain seeds. Its leaves are usually small, narrow, and covered in fine hairs. Berteroa gintlii is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low rainfall.
